successfulResults.originalText: There is also a strong business case for accessibility....
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
There is a good reason to make things accessible.

* It makes sense for business.
* Many people want to use your product or service.
* They will be happy and come back.
* This helps your business grow...

successfulResults.originalText: There is also a strong business case for accessibility. As shown in the previous section, accessible design improves overall user experience and satisfaction, especially in a variety of situations, ac...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
You want a strong business case for making things easy to use.

• Easy to use things make people happy.
• People are happy when they can use things on many devices.
• Older people are happy when thing...

successfulResults.originalText: Web accessibility is required by law in many situations....
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
You must make the website accessible to everyone.

* This is a law in many places.
* It helps people with disabilities use the website....

successfulResults.originalText: More Info on Accessibility is Important...
successfulResults.simplifiedText: Knowing more about making things easy to use is helpful....

successfulResults.originalText:
General information on business benefits is in The Business Case for Digital Accessibility.
    
      Examples of the benefits of making audio and video media accessible is in the section Benefits to...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
To learn about business benefits:

* Read a document called The Business Case for Digital Accessibility.
* Look at the section called Benefits to Organizations.
* It shows examples of benefits from ma...

successfulResults.originalText: The Business Case for Digital Accessibility...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Making Websites and Apps Easy to Use

You want people to visit your website or use your app.
But some people have trouble using them.

Why is that?
Some people have disabilities.
They need help using ...

successfulResults.originalText: Examples of the benefits of making audio and video media accessible is in the section Benefits to Organizations....
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Benefits of making media accessible are many.

* You can reach more people.
* They can use your media better.
* This helps your organization....

successfulResults.originalText: making audio and video media accessible...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Making audio and video media accessible:

* Make audio and video easy to use.
* So everyone can see and hear.
* No matter their ability.
* Or where they are....

successfulResults.originalText: Benefits to Organizations...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Benefits to Organizations

You get these benefits:

* Better work
* More money
* Happy employees
* Good reputation
* Increased sales...

successfulResults.originalText: Guidance on figuring out legal requirements is in the archived Legal and Policy Factors....
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
To find out what the law says:

* Look for the Legal and Policy Factors.
* It's in the archived section.
* This will help you know the rules....

successfulResults.originalText: Legal and Policy Factors...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Legal and Policy Factors

You need to know about laws and rules.

* Laws are like rules for everyone.
* Governments make these laws.
* Laws help keep people safe.

Policy is like a plan.
* Policies ar...

successfulResults.originalText: Making the Web Accessible...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Making the Web Easy to Use

You want to visit websites but have trouble.

* Some websites are hard to read.
* Some websites are hard to use.
* You need help to make them better.

We can make the web e...

successfulResults.originalText: Web accessibility depends on several components working together, including web technologies, web browsers and other "user agents", authoring tools, and websites....
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Making websites easy to use is important. 

It needs many things to work together. These things are:

* Web technologies (special computer codes)
* Web browsers (like Google Chrome)
* Other tools that...

successfulResults.originalText: The W3C Web Accessibility Initiative (WAI) develops technical specifications, guidelines, techniques, and supporting resources that describe accessibility solutions. These are considered international...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
When you want to make websites accessible:

* W3C WAI makes rules for websites.
* These rules help people with disabilities use websites.
* They are used all around the world.
* WCAG 2.0 is one of the...

successfulResults.originalText: More Info on Making the Web Accessible...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Making the Web Accessible

You want to make the web easy to use.

* What does that mean?
* It means everyone can use it.
* People with disabilities can use it too.

The web should be easy to read and ...

successfulResults.originalText: More about these aspects of accessibility working together is in Essential Components of Web Accessibility....
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
To learn more about accessibility:

* Read a document called Essential Components of Web Accessibility.
* It explains how different things work together....

successfulResults.originalText: Essential Components of Web Accessibility...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Web Accessibility is important.

You need to make your website:

* Easy to see
* Easy to hear
* Easy to use


Easy to see:

* Use big text
* Use high contrast colors
* Avoid flashing lights

Easy to h...

successfulResults.originalText: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG), Authoring Tool Accessibility Guidelines (ATAG), ARIA for Accessible Rich Internet Applications, and other important resources are introduced in W3C Accessi...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
When you want to make websites and apps better:

* Look at W3C Accessibility Standards Overview.
* Learn about these important tools:
  • WCAG (helps make websites better)
  • ATAG (helps make tools f...

successfulResults.originalText: W3C Accessibility Standards Overview...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
W3C Accessibility Standards

These standards help make websites and apps easy to use.

* They make sure everyone can use them.
* People with disabilities can use them too.

The standards are about:

*...

successfulResults.originalText: To learn more about how W3C WAI develops material through multi-stakeholder, international participation and how you can contribute, see About W3C WAI and Participating in WAI....
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
To learn more:

* Go to About W3C WAI.
* Learn about W3C WAI's work.
* See how you can help....

successfulResults.originalText: Participating in WAI...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Participating in WAI

WAI is short for Web Accessibility Initiative. 

* It is a group that helps make the web better for everyone.
* They work on making websites and apps easy to use.
* This includes...

successfulResults.originalText: Making Your Website Accessible...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Making Your Website Accessible

You want people to visit your website. But some people have trouble using it. They might be blind, deaf, or have other problems. You can make your website better for th...

successfulResults.originalText: Many aspects of accessibility are fairly easy to understand and implement. Some accessibility solutions are more complex and take more knowledge to implement....
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Some things are easy to make accessible. Others are harder.

* Easy things include:
  - Making signs clear
  - Using simple language

Harder things need more knowledge....

successfulResults.originalText: It is most efficient and effective to incorporate accessibility from the very beginning of projects, so you don’t need go back and to re-do work....
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Make projects accessible from the start.

* This helps a lot.
* You won't have to fix things later.
* You'll save time and effort....

successfulResults.originalText: More Info on Making Your Website Accessible...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Making Your Website Accessible

You want your website to be easy to use. 

* What does that mean?
* It means people with disabilities can use your website.

Why is this important?

* Many people have ...

successfulResults.originalText: For an introduction to accessibility requirements and international standards, see Accessibility Principles....
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
To learn about making things accessible:

* See the Accessibility Principles page....

successfulResults.originalText: Accessibility Principles...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Accessibility Principles

You want to make things easy to use for everyone.

* Make things clear and simple.
* Use words people understand.
* Explain new words the first time you use them.
* Use pictu...

successfulResults.originalText: To understand some common accessibility barriers from the perspective of testing, see Easy Checks – A First Review of Web Accessibility....
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
To understand some common problems:

* Look at Easy Checks – A First Review of Web Accessibility.
* This helps you see some common problems....

successfulResults.originalText: Easy Checks – A First Review of Web Accessibility...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Easy Checks

We will look at some basic things to check web accessibility.

1. Is the website easy to use?
   - Can you find what you need?
   - Can you use the website on a phone?

2. Are images and ...

successfulResults.originalText: For some basic considerations on designing, writing, and developing for accessibility, see Tips for Getting Started....
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
To make things more accessible:

* Read Tips for Getting Started.
* Learn about designing, writing, and developing for accessibility....

successfulResults.originalText: Tips for Getting Started...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Getting Started

You want to start. That's great!

* Take a deep breath.
* Read this text slowly.
* Ask a friend for help if you need it....

successfulResults.originalText:
When you’re ready to know more about developing and designing, you’ll probably use resources such as:
    
      How to Meet WCAG (Quick Reference)
      Web Accessibility Tutorials...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:

* Look for resources online.
* Use these resources to help you:
  • Learn about making websites accessible.
  • Follow the rules in "How to Meet WCAG" (a guide to making ...

successfulResults.originalText: How to Meet WCAG (Quick Reference)...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
WCAG is a rule for making websites easy to use.

WCAG stands for Web Content Accessibility Guidelines. 

WCAG helps people with disabilities use the internet.

WCAG has four main rules:

* Perceivable...

successfulResults.originalText: Web Accessibility Tutorials...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Making Websites Accessible

You want to make your website easy to use for everyone.
 
• What is web accessibility?
 
Web accessibility means your website can be used by people with disabilities.
 
• W...

successfulResults.originalText:
For project management and organizational considerations, see Planning and Managing Web Accessibility.
If you need to make quick fixes now, see Web Accessibility First Aid: Approaches for Interim Repa...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
For project management and organization, see:

* Planning and Managing Web Accessibility

If you need to fix things quickly, see:

* Web Accessibility First Aid: Approaches for Interim Repairs...

successfulResults.originalText: Planning and Managing Web Accessibility...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Making Websites Accessible

You want to make your website easy to use.

* Websites should be easy for everyone to use.
* This includes people with disabilities.
* It also includes people who use phone...

successfulResults.originalText: Web Accessibility First Aid: Approaches for Interim Repairs...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Making Websites Accessible: Quick Fixes

When you find a problem on a website:

* Check the website's rules (accessibility guidelines).
* Fix the problem right away.
* Make sure it's easy to use for e...

successfulResults.originalText: Evaluating Accessibility...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Evaluating Accessibility

You want to know if something is easy to use.
 
You need to check if it is:

* Easy to understand
* Easy to use
* Works well with different devices
* Works well with differen...

successfulResults.originalText: When developing or redesigning a website, evaluate accessibility early and throughout the development process to identify accessibility problems early, when it is easier to address them. Simple steps,...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
When you make a website:

* Evaluate accessibility early.
* Check it often during development.

This helps you find problems early.
It's easier to fix them then.

Some steps are simple, like:

* Chang...

successfulResults.originalText: There are evaluation tools that help with evaluation. However, no tool alone can determine if a site meets accessibility guidelines. Knowledgeable human evaluation is required to determine if a site i...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
We have tools to help us check websites.

* These tools are not enough.
* They can't say if a site is truly accessible.
* A person with knowledge is needed to check this....

successfulResults.originalText: assistive technologies...
successfulResults.simplifiedText: Tools that help people with disabilities....

successfulResults.originalText: Just as images aren’t available to people who can’t see, audio files aren’t available to people who can’t hear. Providing a text transcript makes the audio information accessible to people who are dea...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
People who can't hear can't use audio files. 

A text transcript helps people who are deaf or hard of hearing. 

It also helps search engines and other machines....

successfulResults.originalText: It’s easy and relatively inexpensive for websites to provide transcripts. There are also transcription services that create text transcripts in HTML format....
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Websites can add transcripts easily and cheaply.

* Transcripts are text versions of audio or video.
* Some services make transcripts in HTML format.
* This helps people understand websites better....

successfulResults.originalText: transcription services...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Transcription services:

* Write down what someone says.
* Listen to audio or video.
* Type what is being said.
* Create a written copy....

successfulResults.originalText: Tips for Getting Started...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Getting Started

You want to start. That's good.

Here are some tips:

* Take small steps.
* Don't be afraid to ask for help.
* Practice every day.
* Be patient with yourself....

successfulResults.originalText: Easy Checks – A First Review of Web Accessibility...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
We will make a website easy to use.

Easy Checks is a first look at web accessibility.

It helps you see if a website is easy to use.

You can check these things:

* Can you see the text on the websit...

Here are some videos and descriptions about web accessibility:

*   Videos explain how to make websites easy to use.
*   Descriptions help people with disabilities use websites.

successfulResults.originalText: W3C WAI provides a wide range of resources on different aspects of web accessibility standards, education, testing/evaluation, project management, and policy. We encourage you to explore this website,...

* Look at our website.
* Learn about web accessibility.
* Find tools to test your website.
* Get help with project management.

successfulResults.originalText: project management, and policy...

* Plan what you need to do.
* Control how you do it.

Policy is a set of rules to follow.

* It helps you make good choices.
* It keeps everyone s...

successfulResults.originalText: Strategies, standards, resources to make the Web accessible to people with disabilities...
successfulResults.simplifiedText:
Making the Web Accessible

You want the Web to be for everyone.

* Strategies: plans to make the Web better
* Standards: rules to follow for accessibility
* Resources: tools and help to make it happen...

* We follow rules to make our website easy to use.
* These rules are called the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG).
* WCAG helps people with disabil...
